intro: Hibiscus watsonii, commonly known as Watson's hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, preferring moist, sandy soils. Hibiscus watsonii has heart-shaped leaves and produces fruits that are capsules containing numerous seeds. It plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
